Runs the TBSignatureProfiler using selected datasets, profiles, and assays

Source: R/runTBsigProfilerFunction.R
runTBsigProfilerFunction.Rd

The runTBsigProfilerFunction allows for different datasets, profiles, and assays to be pulled into a datatable, allowing for easy searching, sorting, and visualization

Usage

runTBsigProfilerFunction(
  selected_dataset,
  selected_profiles,
  selected_assay,
  selected_algorithm,
  selected_signatures,
  selected_colData
)

Arguments

selected_dataset

The selected dataset (summarized experiment object) to be viewed. Required.

selected_profiles

The group of selected profiles (Anderson_42/Berry_393/etc) to be viewed. Allows for only select profiles to appear within dt output. Required.

selected_assay

The assay used in the profiler (counts, log counts, etc). Required.

selected_algorithm

The algorithm (GSVA/ssGSEA) to be used in the tbSigProfiler. Required

selected_signatures

The signatures that are available for the profiler to run on. Necessary, as updates to TBsignatures occur within this app. Required.

selected_colData

Selects the specific info that is viewed in the data table output. For example: Age, TBStatus, Gender. Required.

Value

A datatable with results on expression info, as well as ID and a single Column of interest

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
runTBsigProfilerFunction(selected_dataset, selected_profiles, selected_assay, selected_algorithm, selected_signatures, selected_colData)
} # }
